combatEffectTemplates.description: Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that is removed after a number of the character's turns, and at the end of a fight. Also configures the icons turn text to show the number of turns remaining.

Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that is removed after a number of the character's target's turns, and at the end of a fight. Also configures the icons turn text to show the number of turns remaining
Mixin Template. Defines a behaviour that removes an effect at the end of the fight.

Mixin Template. Defines a behaviour that applies static modifiers when the effect is applied. Intended for use when the modifiers do not change during the lifecyle of the effect. Adds the modifier's descriptions to the effects tooltip.

Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for applying modifiers that increase in strength each time the effect is (re)applied, up to a maximum amount. Adds the modifier's descriptions, and the number of stacks applied to the effects tooltip.
A Modifier effect that applies static modifiers, and counts down on the character's turn
A Modifier effect that applies static modifiers, and counts down on the character's target's turn
A Modifier effect that applies static modifiers, that lasts until the end of combat
A Modifier effect that applies stacking modifiers, and counts down on the character's turn
A Modifier effect that applies stacking modifiers, and counts down on the character's target's turn
A Modifier effect that applies stacking modifiers, that lasts until the end of combat
Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that increases a character's attack interval for a number of their turns. Requires behaviours that adjust the stacks modifierGroup
A Modifier effect that applies static modifier equal to the magnitude parameter

Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that: Interrupts a character's turn when applied; prevents them from attacking, evading attacks or regenerating barrier and causes them to take additional damage for a number of turns.

Endpoint Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that: Interrupts a character's turn when applied; prevents then from attacking or regenerating barrier, and causes them to take 30% more damage. Also grants immunity to stuns for 3 turns.
Endpoint Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that: Interrupts a character's turn when applied; prevents then from attacking or regenerating barrier, and causes them to take 30% more damage.
Endpoint Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that: Interrupts a character's turn when applied; prevents then from attacking or regenerating barrier, and causes them to take 50% more damage.
Endpoint Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that: Interrupts a character's turn when applied; prevents then from attacking or regenerating barrier, and causes them to take 20% more damage.
Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that applies modifiers that increase in strength each time the character is hit by an attack, up to a maximum value.

Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that applies modifiers that decrease in strength each time the character is hit by an attack. The effect is removed if the applied modifiers reach zero.
Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that applies modifiers that increase at the end of each character turn

Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that applies modifiers that increase in strength at the end of a character's turn, up to a maximum value. The turn after the modifiers reach the maximum value, they are reset to zero.

An effect that applies fixed modifiers to a character while it is applied. Has a stacks parameter that is increased by the stacksToAdd parameter when the effect is re-applied, and decreased at the end of the character's turn. The effect is removed if the stacks parameter reaches 0, or combat ends.
An effect that applies stacks of modifiers. Stacks are increased by 1 each time the character hits with an attack. The effect is removed if the character misses with an attack , or combat ends.
Mixin Template. Defines a timer named 'proc' that fires an unlimited number of times at a fixed interval after the effect is applied.
Mixin Template. Defines a timer named 'proc' that fires a limited number of times at a fixed interval after the effect is applied. The effect is removed when the timer is finished firing.

Mixin Template. Defines an effect that deals a total amount of damage, spread out over a number of 'procs' that occur at a fixed interval. A DamageCharacter/DamageBarrier behaviour that triggers on the 'proc' TimerFired, should be defined on descendant data.
A Healing over Time effect that lasts until the end of combat.
Base template for all curse effects. Curse effects apply fixed modifiers for 3 of the character's turns. Only 1 curse effect can be active at once.

Mixin Template. Defines behaviours for an effect that counts for a number of turns, and resets the count to a fixed value when they reach 0. Intended for use for an effect that needs to have a behaviour that triggers every X self turns.
An effect that heals the character by a percentage of their current hitpoints every X turns.
An effect that heals the character by a percentage of their max hitpoints every X turns.
An effect that heals the character by a percentage of their current hitpoints minus any slayer effect negation every X turns.
Base template for Fear effects. Interrupts a character's turn when applied, and increases their attack interval by 30% for the next turn. Also grants immunity to Fear effects for 3 turns.
An effect that applies modifiers equal to a number of stacks. A stack is removed at the end of each turn. The effect is removed when the stacks reach 0, or at the end of a fight.
An effect that heals the character's barrier by a percentage of it's maximum every X turns. Also applies the Barrier Regen Debuff.
An effect that applies modifiers equal to a number of stacks. A stack is removed each time this character hits with an attack. The effect is removed when the stacks reach 0, or at the end of a fight.
An effect that applies modifiers for XTurns, then removes them for XTurns

baseEffectData.turnText: (p.turns % p.period < p.onTurns) ? (p.onTurns - p.turns % p.period) : (p.period - p.turns % p.period)

shopPurchases.customDescription: +${qty} Maximum Bank Space

Using your current equipped food only, automatically consume the food to fill your Hitpoints to at least 40% when it is equal to or below 20% Hitpoints. Food Efficiency: 60% (Food heals for 60% of the value shown when Auto Eating).

Using your current equipped food only, automatically consume the food to fill your Hitpoints to at least 60% when it is equal to or below 30% Hitpoints. Food Efficiency: 80% (Food heals for 80% of the value shown when Auto Eating).

Using your current equipped food only, automatically consume the food to fill your Hitpoints to at least 80% when it is equal to or below 40% Hitpoints. Food Efficiency: 100% (Food heals for 100% of the value shown when Auto Eating).
Unlock an extra Equipment Set for Combat.
Enable Equipment Set swapping during Dungeons.
Unlock the ability to cut 2 different trees in Woodcutting. Logs, Skill XP and Mastery XP granted based on highest interval.
Automatically equip Food that is Actively Cooked if that Food is already equipped or an empty Food slot is available. This can be toggled on or off.
When running out of Food in Combat, automatically swap to a different Food Slot that contains food. This can be toggled on or off.

tutorialStages.name: Survival Task 1
tutorialStages.description: Woodcutting is a basic Skill that provides Logs to create various weaponry and items. It is possible to find a Bird Nest while Woodcutting that provides Seeds for Farming.

tutorialStages.name: Survival Task 2
tutorialStages.description: Firemaking provides bonuses to other Skills in the game at later stages of the game.

tutorialStages.name: Survival Task 3
tutorialStages.description: One main source of Food comes from Fishing. You can catch many different Fish here, and also find many rare and unique Special Items as well.

tutorialStages.name: Survival Task 4
tutorialStages.description: Your main Food production Skill. Cook Fish and Farming products here to keep you alive in your Combat adventures.

tutorialStages.name: Combat Task 1
tutorialStages.description: Mining provides the resources required for most Melee Weapons and Armour. You can also find Rune Essence here which is used for Runecrafting.

tutorialStages.name: Combat Task 2
tutorialStages.description: Smithing turns your Mining resources into products that can be used to create Melee Weapons and Armour, as well as some other good stuff.

tutorialStages.name: Combat Task 3
tutorialStages.description: Weapons, Armour and Food can be equipped from the Bank. Give it a go so you are ready for battle!

tutorialStages.name: Combat Task 4
tutorialStages.description: Have a go at slaying one of the many unique Monsters you can locate in Melvor.

tutorialStages.name: Wannabe Farmer 1
tutorialStages.description: Lastly we have Farming. You can plant seeds that grow over time to produce different Allotments, Herbs or Trees. This can be done alongside any Skill you are training. Seeds have a 50% chance to die unless you use COMPOST. Grab some from the Shop.

tutorialStages.name: Wannabe Farmer 2
tutorialStages.description: Have a go at planting those Potato Seeds we gave you. Allotments require 3 Seeds to plant. I highly recommend you apply Compost to your Farming plot, but you don't have to if you believe luck will be on your side. Plants have feelings too you know.
